info.title: Congress API
info.description:
## Welcome

This is a place to put general notes and extra information, for internal use.

To get started designing/documenting this API, select a version on the left.

votes.question: On Agreeing to the Resolution
votes.description: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1644) STREAM Act; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (S.J.Res. 22) congressional disapproval of the rule submitted by the Corps of Engineers and the EPA relating to “waters of the U.S.”; and consideration of (H.R. 3662) Iran Terror Finance Transparency Act

parameters.name: congress-number
parameters.description: The number of the Congress in which the bill was introduced/updated

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Types introduced, updated and passed are the 20 most recent bills in each category as reported by the THOMAS site.

The parameter major retrieves the 20 most recent bills (for the specified chamber) that have been labeled as significant by The New York Times.

When type = introduced, the introduced_date determines the set of recent bills. When type = updated, the latest_major_action_date determines the result set.

application/json.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 The New York Times Company. All Rights Reserved.

The bill's unique ID number.

Bill ID numbers are included in bill summary responses as url_number

parameters.name: member-id
parameters.description: The member's unique ID number

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
cosponsored: the 20 bills most recently cosponsored by member-id.
withdrawn: the 20 most recently withdrawn cosponsorships for member-id.

When type = introduced, the introduced_date determines the set of recent bills. When type = updated, the latest_major_action_date determines the result set. See the sample responses for examples of bill summary data.

members.note: Appointed to replace Max S. Baucus; sworn in on Feb. 11, 2014.
Announced that he would leave office at the end of 2014.
Appointed to Senate on Feb. 1, 2013, to replace John Kerry. Replaced by Edward J. Markey on July 16, 2013.
Announced retirement on April 23, 2013. Appointed ambassador to China and resigned on Feb. 6, 2014.
Resigned on Feb. 1, 2013 to become Secretary of State.
Filled vacancy created by the death of Democrat Frank R. Lautenberg. Replaced by Cory Booker.
